headline: Gangstalking Paranoia and Delusions Explored
article:
A heated discussion unfolded around the concept of "gangstalking," with participants sharing extreme beliefs about coordinated harassment by shadowy entities. One user detailed alleged tactics: "Flat tires, sleep deprivation, drugging food, putting dirt on targets property. Mass strangers doing things in public to annoy targets." Others described "street theatre," where strangers supposedly mimic conversations or behaviors to provoke psychological distress. Skeptics dismissed these claims as paranoid delusions, with one mocking, "Face it, most agents will be infinitely more successful than any of you sad virgins ever will be."  

Conspiracy theories expanded to include government involvement, with references to MKUltra and FBI surveillance. A user insisted, "They identify these people and then they become targeted individuals." Some cited patents and historical documents to validate claims of mind-control technology. However, critics countered, "Nobody who shitposts on /x/ nowadays is holding codes for ballistic missiles."  

Personal anecdotes dominated the thread, including one userâ€™s disturbing childhood narrative: "get drugged and raped as a child continuously... parents bring me on foreign vacations, drug me, sell me." Others debated whether gangstalking was a cover for mental illness, with one concluding, "They are mentally ill with paranoid delusions." The thread devolved into insults, with targets and skeptics clashing over credibility. Despite the chaos, no concrete evidence was presented, leaving the debate unresolved.
